title: one must visit the Mussoorie Heritage Centre
review: this in not much crowed place. nice place to visit near clock tower landour. you can see old mussoori photos, sketch and old paintings. a must visit place

title: Good place to get a feel of local heritage
review: This is a nice place to visit near the Clock Tower in Landour.

title: Not that great but at least better then many shops which sell stuff that you can get elsewhere too.
review: Mussoorie was not in our original plan so I had not studied about its attractions/must visit places/restaurants etc. When we accidentally discovered this place, I vaguely remembered having read about it on TA so we went inside. I liked some of the exhibits and the idea that someone has tried to reproduce the feel of Raj times. I liked the idea of putting pictures of John Gould's paintings and sketches and paintings used in T.C. Jerdon's book. We bought T-shirts with Jabarkhet printed on them, a book and a few more things. We failed to meet owner and were entertained by a young girl. While writing the review I read comment of someone who has mentioned that this center is located in Pahari Wilson;s house. Well, if it comes to buildings, I have noticed a lot of buildings that have a character and would like to know who owned them in Raj times and what use they were of in olden times.

title: historic
review: Every state must have one of its own heritage centre to preserve the tradition and artifacts of the locality besides holding important functions

title: Old building
review: This building is very old near clock tower in Landour marking. Old photos and painting of Mussoorie are displayed inside. Visit this place if you have some spare time.

title: must visit for art lovers
review: a great place near clock tower. we reached there without any planning and it was our pleasure. you can see photos of old mussoorie and some sketches. really we loved this place

title: Honest glimpse into Mussoorie!!
review: Its  not very common when you come across a genuine effort by someone to preserve the culture and heritage of a place and yet not go overboard.

title: Must visit for every history lover
review: This is the only place in Mussoorie which has displays the history of the city. Surbhi was really kind enough to take us a tour of her antique collections. We were also fascinated with the book marks and cards made by differently abled kids.

title: Good information
review: Its a lovely small.place which u might miss on way up to Lal Tibba. But there ia lovely history there. The people in charge take you througb tbe lovely display of photos. There are good artedacts and souvenirs too. They deserve to be visited and have a good conversation with.

title: Hidden gem of Mussoorie-Landour
review: Chance visit when walking to Lal Tibba. We met the delightful owner, Surubhi, and what a pleasure to listen about Mussoorie from someone who grew up there and knows what we're losing to "Development".

title: good to know
review: Art lovers paradise and also good to know to information for people to know the history of the place

title: Amazing place
review: Amazing place !!

title: Walk through the history of Mussorie
review: An excellent initiative set in a heritage building itself. You can see old photos, sketches, paintings of Mussoorie and around. You can buy souvenirs from them, quite a few of them hand made by local women.

title: Browsing for souvenirs at Landour Bazaar
review: Mussoorie Heritage Centre occupies a strategic corner of the historic Parade Point House, once owned by the legendary Pahari Wilson (1816-83), the famous timber magnate of Garhwal. The Centre is the best place in town for high quality souvenirs of Mussoorie/ Landour, whether you are looking for framed photographs, wooden trays, exquisite embroidery, souvenir mugs or baskets. Most of the products are sourced from self-help groups located in or around Mussoorie and Dehradun. You can learn a lot from Surabhi, the energetic and committed owner of the Centre. In addition to the Centre, there is an old fashioned antique shop next door, owned by Surabhi’s father - it’s a treasure house of old jewellery, sculptures, crockery and assorted bric-a-brac.

title: Excellent place to visit
review: I used to buy antiques from the shop next door, which is held in the same family. The Heritage Centre is very interesting and helps local  NGOs by selling their products. Stop in next time you are in the bazaar.

title: Expensive but worth it
review: The best thing about MHC is its location. Located next to the historic Landour clock tower ( demolished but being rebuilt now) it is situated in the historic Parade Point house which was once owned by Pahari Wilson. The house has been restored well. Inside you can see display of old photographs of Mussoorie and Landour. You can buy the prints and other souveniers here.

title: Worth a quick potter if you happen to be passing
review: Only a small room, next door to an Antiques shop, but some nice photos of old Mussoorie and a small selection of interesting souvenirs on sale.

title: Great history
review: For a slice of Mussoorie's history, one must visit the Mussoorie Heritage Centre, a private enterprise showcasing the history

title: Very informative
review: I stumbled upon this on my walkabout and the lady assistant was able to answer all my  questions on Mussoorie and its history.  Was impressed that they sold products made by local people  and not a plastic fridge magnet in sight!

title: Nice place
review: It is a very compact place with lots of artistic things.  we loved this place as it was not crowded.  Liked knowing history of this place.

title: old mussoorie
review: it shows the history of mussoorie.. as I was not very fond to visit this place.. my husband decided to make me visit it.. but had a good one.. it takes u back into time showcasing the old mussoorie..

title: Wel informed
review: for me this place was very informative as the Suman ( the owner) told me so many things about mossurie. I thing u shld visit this place and check out the place.

title: A quick history of Mussorie, all one place
review: You must visit this place to see the collection of pics they have of old mussorie. Wonderful. They also have a curio shop and they stock some exclusive vintage./ antique

title: Kudos and Bravo Mussoorie Heritage Centre
review: What an excellent way to bring awareness to Mussoorie's undiscovered Heritage and History.

title: Only for art lovers
review: Only recommended for people who really love art. Mussorrie has many good scenic points like company garden and lal tibba

title: Heritage of Mussoorie
review: The place is run by an enterprising and passionate lady called Surabhi who has done a lot of research to put together the heritage of Mussoorie. In addition, she also does heritage walks and exhibitions. Must must go. Pick up souvenirs as well! Small. Quaint. Very overwhelming.

title: Venture In A heritage Building
review: Mussoorie Heritage Centre is a private enterprise opened in November'2013 in a historical  180 year old building, hence this name Heritage Centre..

title: Cosy Informative place
review: The Mussoorie Heritage centre is a good place for people who have no prior information about Mussoorie. it's a welcoming and cosy place with images and artefacts of times past. For beginners, this place is a good stepping stone to learn about the history of this area.

title: Brings Mussoorie to life
review: I strongly recommend that everyone starts their visit to Mussoorie at this place. It gives you a lot of history and information about Mussoorie, which has a surprisingly interesting past. Keep an hour aside for this visit, it will bring Mussoorie into context, bring it to life, and enable you to understand what you see and experience much better.

title: Can be tried
review: I am not like a heritage person so I didn't like much about this place. My spouse liked it and she did shopping.

title: A window into the old Mussoorie
review: The Heritage Centre is just a 10-15 minute walk from the Picture Palace, and a great stopping off point on the way to Lal Tibba. The owners have put together a marvellous array of photos from a bygone era in Mussoorie. They give a great insight into what life was like here before rickshaws (and cars) came to the mall. The photos also show the costumes of the day, the magnificence of some of the older Mussoorie properties, and the people who were influential in these early days. It is well-worth a visit.

title: Fascinating pictorial histories
review: Adjacent to the old Clock Tower area, the MHC curator, Ms. S~ has done a great job compiling historical pictures and writings. We went a couple times. Her wealth of knowledge is captivating. Go next door to the antique shop.

title: Average Value
review: This place is not too good not too bad depending upon time if you have extra time you can visit it.

title: Fine place
review: This is fine heritage place where people can hangout and chill.

title: Very interesting collection
review: Surbhi is a lover of historic Mussoorie and has collected a good range of old photos and memorabilia. She now offers historic walks around the hill station and is a wealth of knowledge.
